The perfect location for business travelers and couples alike!

The North End is a neighborhood of Boston, Massachusetts, United States. It has the distinction of being the city's oldest residential community, where people have continuously inhabited since it was settled in the 1630s. Though small, only 0.36 square miles (0.93 km2), the neighborhood has nearly one hundred establishments and a variety of tourist attractions.

This home has historic charm but has been fully renovated!

Due to Boston's new and very restrictive short-term rental law, starting Sep 1, 2019, we have switched to renting units for only a minimum of 32 days (because 28 days is the cap set by Boston and 31 days is the cap set by Massachusetts). It's unfortunate for us and our many happy guests as we really enjoyed hosting - but it seems the hotel-lobby had deeper pockets. Anyway, please do stay with us if you need 32 or more days.

1600 square feet. 2 floors. 1st floor is 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom, kitchen, breakfast nook and living room (with a pull out sofa-bed). 2nd floor has 2 bedrooms and 1 bathroom.

Must be Covid vaccinated. Read our rules, please. Your delightful hosts have been residents since 1972. This is 1 of 2 rooms in a beautiful Bostonian Victorian townhouse in the popular South End with a plethora of restaurants and shops and convenient to attractions. Each bedroom has a full-size antique brass bed, a desk, and a decorative fireplace. The 2 fourth-floor guest rooms share a bath with a tub and shower. Expanded continental breakfast provided. No arrivals after 10 pm.

Visiting Boston- one of the oldest cities in the United States- is a one of a kind experience. Follow the steps that shaped the story of this country along the Freedom Trail and explore the sites where the American Revolution took place: the Old State House, Faneuil Hall, or Boston Common will take you to another era. Walk alongside history in this surprising city that combines traditional Victorian brownstone houses, spectacular modern high-rises, hundreds of acres of green space, and breathtaking harbors that provide a gateway to the Atlantic. Visiting Boston- one of the oldest cities in the United States- is a one of a kind experience. Follow the steps that shaped the story of this country along the Freedom Trail and explore the sites where the American Revolution took place.

The space
Visiting Boston- one of the oldest cities in the United States- is a one of a kind experience. Follow the steps that shaped the story of this country along the Freedom Trail and explore the sites where the American Revolution took place: the Old State House, Faneuil Hall, or Boston Common will take you to another era. Walk alongside history in this surprising city that combines traditional Victorian brownstone houses, spectacular modern high-rises, hundreds of acres of green space, and breathtaking harbors that provide a gateway to the Atlantic. Enjoy the wide cultural offer of Boston’s Theatre District or mingle with locals in the trendy Back Bay area, where you will find the best shopping and dining in Massachusetts.

A convenient location and your comfortable retreat at the end of the day when you’re visiting friends or family in Boston, or you’re here for education, research, training, the marathon, doing locums or traveler work, you’re coming to have your baby, or to receive specialized medical treatment at one of Boston’s premier hospitals.

The space
A three-bedroom house on two floors (referred to as either upstairs or downstairs) which consists of:
3 bedrooms upstairs, plus a bonus playroom downstairs adjacent to the dining room with a single bed (but no door to close off to the dining room), a full bathroom upstairs with a shower-tub combination, a half bath downstairs, a living room downstairs, a dining room downstairs with a generous solid-wood acacia table that can seat a whole party for a festive dinner, but is just as amazing for working on your laptop with a fresh cup of coffee and warm croissants from the neighborhood bakery Athan’s on Washington street.

This apartment is professionally managed by Furnished Quarters, the largest independently owned and operated supplier of short-term furnished housing with over 20 years of experience in the industry. This upscale, pet-friendly West End apartment building near the Charles River waterfront boasts amenities such as concierge service, a 24-hour fitness center, a swimming pool, a media room with theater seating, a resident lounge, on-site Zipcar vehicle rentals and more. The pet-friendly property also offers an on-site dog park. The surrounding West End neighborhood is where Boston's major medical institutions are found, such as Massachusetts General Hospital, as well as plentiful green space and recreation. Easily travel the rest of the city and metro area by walking to one of four T stations serving the Green, Red, Orange and Blue lines, in addition to two bus stations and the Boston North Amtrak Station.

Places within 1-10 minutes walking distance: Trader Joe's, Star market, McDonald's, Liquor store, Starbucks, Dunkin', Gas station

We are next to Harvard. Our location allows you to enjoy staying in town, and getting around easily. Walking distance to Harvard Business School, Boston University, Boston Landing, New Balance headquarter and the new training facility for the the Boston Bruins and Celtics. Large and charming bedrooms good for relax. Expecting to share the apt with friendly people.

The space
SELF CHECK-IN! We have a smart lock. We will be sending you a keypad code prior to your arrival.

Guest access
We will give you a keycode for the house, so you can come and go as you want. Bathroom: shower, take as many as you want! I will provide you with towels and shampoo. You are welcome to have a bath, but on your own as it will not fit more than one adult. We have coffee and tea in the kitchen ,help yourself.

Li

What’s more exciting than the latest sell-out show in the Theater District? This gorgeous condo, of course! Within just a couple blocks of Boston Common, Chinatown, and the top arts venues in town, this modern apartment is the perfect home base for any trip to Boston. Highlights include:
-Luxurious decor, high ceilings, and large windows
-Modern kitchen with stainless steel appliances
-Hotel-style lobby, fitness center, and 24-hour concierge
-Historic architecture with a fully renovated interior

The space
We don’t mean to be dramatic, but this spectacular Theater District condo is one of our favorite spots in Boston. With a fantastic location between Chinatown and Boston Common, it’s a great place to rest and relax between adventures around town.

Throughout the apartment, you’ll find historic touches next to modern conveniences, giving it a unique old-meets-new charm. Bedrooms include colorful artwork, crisp bedding, and large windo

Stay in the heart of Boston’s historic and popular South End Neighborhood in an amazing studio with everything you need! The historic location will allow you to truly live like a Bostonian and have an authentic Boston experience!

Booking a great value cute and quaint smaller studio will see you benefit from great Wi-Fi, a very comfy bed, and modern kitchen appliances while saving money. There’s an ensuite bathroom with plenty of towels and toiletries provided.

Parking is from $30 a day on a first come first served basis. The studio is near the “T” too for public transportation.

Located in the heart of South Boston, you will be steps from Southie's best restaurants and bars, the "T" and a short walk to the Boston Convention and Exhibition Center (BCEC).

The space
Quarters™ is ideal for up to 2 travelers who are comfortable with sharing bathrooms and common spaces with other guests. The experience is similar to a hostel experience except you have a private bedroom and there are no services or on-site staff. If you are traveling on a tight budget or just need a place to drop bags and lay your head while in Boston, Quarters™ is a great option.
